title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 6.20 - Bus drivers not properly licensed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 6.20 - Bus drivers not properly licensed

State Regulations

The motor carrier shall not knowingly permit any person
to operate a bus carrying passengers unless such operator has fulfilled the
requirements of sections
6.3, 6.8, 6.10, 6.11, and
6.12
of this Part. All bus drivers
must possess a commercial driver license issued by a state or province that
meets the requirements of the Federal Commercial Motor Vehicle Safety Act of
1986. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
6.20

Amended

New

York State Register March 15, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 11, eff. 3/15/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
